title: Web-Based Self-Directed Collaborative Learning for Applying Occupational Therapy Activity Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of basic occupational therapy theories and practical experience
context.additional_context: Real-time interaction-based learning utilizing online collaboration tools (Padlet, Google Docs, etc.) in a digital device-provided environment

learning_goals: Learners can apply a systematic procedure to analyze physical, cognitive, and environmental factors of work activities.
Learners can perform self-reflective feedback by comparing activity analysis results with standard guidelines through collaboration with peers.
Learners can practically connect activity analysis results to occupational therapy intervention planning using web-based tools.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
